commit_message: v0.2.6 Fix allele finding problem with uppercasing strings

v0.2.5: handle input VCFs with differing cases in REF and ALT alleles

Avoids issues when some input VCFs have lower versus uppercase in allele
representations. Consistently convert to upper case for preparation and
comparisons.

Fixes #2924
Fixes #2350

v0.2.4: platypus fix for contig VCF headers

Ensure Platypus output files have contigs in the VCF header, which
avoids downstream errors with GATK4 GatherVcfs.
bcbio/bcbio-nextgen#2688

v0.2.3: fix wrapper script to correctly check for JAVA_HOME

Fixes #22

v0.2.2: support for recent bcftools; improved logging

- Handles issues with recent bcftools, which are more picky about
  input files:
  - Avoid bcftools concat errors with all empty inputs.
  - Remove problematic FreeBayes annotations which no longer match
    header requirements after decomposition.
- Fix logging to correctly raise errors on failures.

v0.2.1: square fix for redundant DP filters to bcftools

Recent versions of bcftools will not process ambiguous filter
specifications like `DP` when present in both INFO and FORMAT files.
This clarifies intent to avoid errors. Thanks to @ohofmann
v0.2.0: update clojure and associated dependencies

v0.1.9: Remove usage of gatk-framework; replace with bcftools

Removes usage of older GATK3 gatk-framework, replacing with
modern bcftools equivalents. gatk-framework is no longer distributed
with bcbio. bcbio/bcbio-nextgen#2412

v0.1.8: fix tabix index error for variants at position 1 of contigs.

Fixes chapmanb/bcbio-nextgen#2383
v0.1.7: Avoid FreeBayes error when running variant-input without an empty VCF. Fixes chapmanb/bcbio-nextgen#1503

Handle non-bgzipped ensemble outputs

Convert these inputs to bgzipped output to avoid GATK issues writing
the index. Fixes #10

Fixes for merging larger numbers of input samples

- Handle larger merge sizes with additional memory specifications up to
  3000 or more samples.
- Use local temporary directories for GATK calls, avoiding filling up
  temporary space. Thanks to @brainstorm.
- Correctly parse sample names from large numbers of inputs without
  causing overflow error.
- Do not silently exit if running into Java memory errors.

v0.1.5: genotype qualities and samtools for CRAM

- Adds genotype qualities for FreeBayes calls. Thanks to @mjafin
- Use samtools for CRAM support to avoid scramble dependency
v0.1.4: Annotate ensemble variant calls with names of callers supporting an ensemble variant

v0.1.3: Support latest GATK and htsjdk

Provides compatibility with GATK 3.4 gVCFs and changes to class
structure in the corresponding htsjdk.
Document requirement for matching VCF and BAM naming (fixes #7)
v0.1.2: Avoid copy errors when running with transactional directories. Fixes chapmanb/bcbio-nextgen#831
Correctly intersect files when one of the inputs is empty. Fixes chapmanb/bcbio-nextgen#826
v0.1.0: Fix sorting issues with X/Y chromosomes (fixes #5). Separate out clhelp support functionality
v0.0.9: FreeBayes: update with options for latest validated version 0.9.21-7
v0.0.8: Avoid copy errors when merging recalls with only a single region.
v0.0.7: additional transactional directories to avoid partially written/copied files at scale (Fixes chapmanb/bcbio-nextgen#771
v0.0.6 release
Support sambamba 0.5.1 indexing without ability to specify output bai file location
Handle BED input files with non-standard line endings

Merge pull request #3 from roryk/master

Fix logic for no regions specification.
Fix logic for no regions specification.
Update vcffixup usage to match stdin changes in latest development vcflib. Thanks to Craig Bohrson
Avoid filtering low quality reference calls when recalling with Platypus. Thanks to Craig Bohrson
Handle inputs to recalling where initial files have identical final file names. Thanks to Craig Bohrson
v0.0.5: handle inputs with multiple identical variant calls, which can happen with FreeBayes output. Thanks to @mjafin
Work to speed up FreeBayes recalling: use additional memory for small merges, make use of samtools for CRAM data and limit FreeBayes alleles evaluated
v0.0.4: FreeBayes recalling fixes to support GATK compatibility: remove duplicate alternative alleles and ceil very low FreeBayes quality scores.

v0.0.3: Fix FreeBayes recalling/squaring off to better distinguish reference and no call. Avoid filtering low-quality reference positions and assigning as no call while still removing problem variants.
Handle intersection retrieval when we have multiple calls with identical ref/alts next to a call
v0.0.2: Document and finalize initial ensemble intersection approach
Ensure unique temporary file names when adding multiple files into ensemble calling with the same basename. Allows usage from bcbio-nextgen processing directories
Enable sorting of multi-sample input files for ensemble calling. Ensures consistent sample ordering for comparison purposes
Add option to remove pre-filtered variants prior to performing ensemble calling. Expected to be the default for tumor/normal calling where we remove germline mutations prior to combining

Initial implementation of count based ensemble calling: intersect files passing only those identified by a specified number of callers. Pick variant at each passing position based on priority: first VCF inputs first if variant is present
Incorporate variant manipulation code from bcbio.variation and re-work to generalize
Initial framework to do intersection and count based ensemble calling from multiple input VCFs
Update Java dependencies to use new combined htsjdk library and picard
v0.0.1: Improve memory usage for large samples and generalize calculation of memory based on number of variant inputs merged
Add samtools squaring off support. Update platypus squaring off with latest filtering from NA12878 evaluations. Improve variant union creation with GATK CombineVariants
Allow passing a region to subset into merging
Generalize memory usage for merging to handle larger inputs
Improve ability to combine variant files: pass list file to CombineVariants for easier debugging and use bcftools concat with input list
Normalize and remove duplicate alleles from Platypus recall output. Duplicates cause issues with GATK post-processing
Provide consistent filtering of FreeBayes and Platypus calls in low depth low quality regions
Memory usage tweaks: avoid parallel GC when running gatk-framework
Fixes to work with latest bedtools: ensure header passed on to merge so can be detected as VCF file and ensure stdin passed to merge
Generalizations for more tricky cases: memory usage on java merge and handle empty regional breakpoint BED files by using the entire region
Move creation of union sites to use GATK framework. bcftools isec does not collapse complex variants which causes long run times in repetitive, hard to resolve regions
Scaling and output fixes: avoid duplicate alleles from recalling with vcfuniqalleles, ensure inputs to GATK merge are bgzipped
Provide VCF merging using GATK framework, make this default option to avoid merge errors with bcftools on complex variants
Swap out use of genomecov with simpler and faster direct manipulations on original BED file
Speed and error reporting improvements: ensure recalling steps run multicore. Do not swallow error messages when running from command line
Speed improvements: prepare pre-computed fai and BED files for when calculating breakpoints to avoid needing to compute over full genome
Improve nesting of in-progress directory structure to avoid large directies when scaling to many samples
Cache sample to BAM/CRAM map to avoid needing to read per-region for large number of input files
Ensure sample prepped and region selected VCFs get passed along to recalling and merging steps to avoid need to re-extract these. Re-make out of date tabix indexes
Expose error message swallowed by rmap when we have duplicate input samples

Merge pull request #2 from roryk/master

Sort BED file by chromosome and position after calculating breakpoints.
Fix issues with correctly placing preparation directory with passed calls. Avoid unnecessary prefix when creating split output directories
Add a sort to the bedtools intersect in fai->bed.
Sort BED file by chromosome and position after calculating breakpoints.

Correctly segregate split determination by input sub-region. Handle ploidy and correctly call in chrM and other non-diploid regions. Write passonly files inside of work directory instead of in initial location.
Improve regional support for squaring off by handling subsetting of reference by BED files/regions. Handle empty VCF files in regional calls
Enable squaring off with either BED file or region (chr1:1-100) specifications to allow parallelization
Enable subsetting of squaring off by chromosome region. Allows external parallelization by region. Fixes to support latest FreeBayes with experimental-gls
Support CRAM files as input to squaring off. Handles automatic conversion of CRAMs to BAM files within genomic regions so they can feed into recalling.
Use freebayes for squaring off/backfilling approaches, requiring recent version with fixes for variant-inputs
Use vt for concatenation instead of vcfcat from vcflib. Provides much faster concatenation on large population VCFs. Requires consistent headers throughout so use recalling even on empty regions
Speed improvements for merging -- enable merging of larger batches with bcftools and bgzip and vcfcat files simultaneously
Pre-filter VCF files removing filtered variants prior to merging. Avoids issues where bcftools merges multiple samples using the union of filters from each sample
Finalize read filtering for Platypus: more lenient badReads and low-depth filtering. Achieved equal quality to FreeBayes/GATK Haplotype callers
Add vcflib/vcffilter based post-platypus filtering to replace bcftools. vcflib handles existing filters correctly
Increase merge size for parallel blocks to avoid large numbers of very small files for processing
Improved platypus filtering: less stringent filters for repetitive regions and multiple haplotypes. Remove hard Q20 filtering and use hard filtering based on quality, depth and het/hom calls
Update bcftools command lines to match the latest 0.2.0-rc6 release
Improvements for running ensemble recalling from commandline: cleanly exit from parallel runs, handle bgzipped or non-bgzipped outputs, tone down platypus verboseness
Add ensemble based calling using platypus. Provide top level command line target to run ensemble calling on potentially multisample input files
Integrate Platypus variant caller into squaring off. Provide functionality to resolve FreeBayes/Platypus headers into final output VCF
Expose squaring off functionality with a top level command line. Extract command line convenience helpers into separate module for better re-use
Finalize end to end workflow for squaring off: create variants to recall, recall with freebayes and merge into final output file
Squaring off work: retrieve BAM files by sample and avoid re-calling regions with BAM files. Setup splitting and prep for recalling each sample in a genomic region
Initial framework for doing squaring off of variant populations. Reuse and generalize existing ensemble and merge functionality
Improve shell script wrapper to support identification of java specific options for memory and properties
Reduce initial merge group size with bcftools to keep memory usage under 2Gb/process
Rework bcftools merging to merge in batches. Keeps memory usage down for large population merges
Create local regional VCF files for input into vcflib and bcftools, trying to avoid indexing penalties and work around file handle errors with piping
Batch vcfcombine commands into pipes to avoid opening large numbers of simultaneous named pipes
Merge files using vcfcombine from vcflib, working to avoid memory issues with large numbers of files to bcftools merge
Fixes for ensemble realignment/recalling with glia and freebayes
Parallelize detection of analysis regions. Handle pre-bgzipped inputs. Avoid errors without JAVA_HOME set
Finalize executable merge command and prepare shell script for easier distribution
Parallelize merging functionality, allowing specification of cores to use. Add initial infrastructure for command line calling.
Concatenation of VCF handles using external vcfcat in vcflib. Handle bgzip and plain VCF
Provide region-based merging of multi-sample VCFs, with parallelization by reducers
Initial framework for parallel VCF merging by minimal genomic region
Finalize identification of blocks of shared variation across multiple samples for parallelization
Convert individual VCF breakpoints into grouped set of parallelization breakpoints in common across all samples
Initial commit of repository for handling parallel merging, recaling, squaring off and ensemble calling
